channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Trump blames China for 'mass worldwide killing', global cases pass 4.95 million

item.description: US legal papers recount the details of Ghosn's escape including his departure from Japan hidden in a large black box aboard a private jet.
item.title: Duo wanted in ex-Nissan boss Ghosn's escape from Japan arrested

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Global COVID-19 cases surpass 4.9 million, Australian death toll stands at 100, Trump mulls rescheduling G7 so it can be held in person

item.description: The companies say their automatic "exposure notification" system can slow the spread of COVID-19 by virus carriers who are interacting with strangers and aren't yet showing symptoms.
item.title: Apple, Google release smartphone technology for pandemic apps

item.description: The study of blood samples by donors showed that 4.6 per cent already had antibodies against the virus at the start of the epidemic.
item.title: Virus circulating in February before first transmission: Italian study

item.description: At first, Amazon told workers about each new case. But when the total reached about 60, the announcements stopped giving specific numbers.
item.title: ‘Way too late’: Inside Amazon’s biggest COVID-19 outbreak

item.description: The inauguration of Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen's second term has been overshadowed by a war of words between Beijing and Washington.
item.title: Donald Trump accuses China of unleashing 'mass worldwide killing!'

item.description: Cyclone Amphan killed at least five people as it swept through eastern India and Bangladesh, accompanied by a storm surge that destroyed hundreds of homes.
item.title: Strongest cyclone in more than a decade tears into India, Bangladesh

item.description: The body of former WWE star Shad Gaspard has been found at Venice Beach in California, two days after he was swept away by a rip as he and his 10-year-old son swam.
item.title: Former WWE wrestler saved his son before being pulled under by rip

item.description: The only man ever convicted in a US court for a role in the September 11 attacks now says he is renouncing terrorism, al-Qaeda and the Islamic State.
item.title: September 11 convict now says he renounces terrorism, Osama bin Laden

item.dc:creator: Julie Power
item.description: Sydney's CBD will grind to a halt unless more than 80 per cent of people who previously used public transport in peak hours change their daily behaviour.
item.title: One giant car park: Sydney commuters urged to rethink their travel

item.description: Follow our rolling coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: The supermarket giant has made its first private startup investment, joining an $8 million funding round for digital consumer products maker Eucalyptus.
item.title: Woolworths joins $8 million funding round for consumer startup Eucalyptus

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, May 21, 2020

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: Wayne Bennett could find himself in hot water for failing to tell the NRL about an incident involving his star five-eighth Cody Walker.
item.title: Bennett facing fine for silence over Walker's role in street fight

item.dc:creator: Nick O'Malley
item.description: There are some positive signs in the government's draft climate change plan, but it falls short of serious action.
item.title: Climate plan leaves the hard work to others

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison is catching up on ideas he dismissed just a year ago, but he has to bring his backbenchers with him.
item.title: Government's tech roadmap reveals its talent for wasting time

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: The technology road map to reduce emissions paves the way for significant spending on energy projects, and it's backing gas over coal.
item.title: Morrison government climate action plan hot on gas, cool on coal

item.dc:creator: Miki Perkins
item.description: Environment and renewable energy groups have condemned the Morrison government’s championing of gas in Australia’s post-pandemic economic recovery.
item.title: Gas-fired rebuild 'polluting and dangerous', green groups warn

item.dc:creator: Julie Power
item.description: About 85 per cent of public transport users will have to switch to bicycles, walk or continue to work from home in order to avoid major traffic jams as COVID-19 restrictions ease, according to new research.
item.title: Distancing tipped to fuel gridlock unless more cycle, walk or stay home

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: Positive signs that businesses are looking to re-hire staff are countered by warnings that full jobs recovery will take years.
item.title: Job ads start to lift but CBDs could take six years to fill again

item.dc:creator: Riley Wilson
item.description: It's fitting that the first United Nations-recognised International Day of Tea will be during one of the greatest global challenges of the century.
item.title: At last, tea is getting the official recognition it deserves

item.dc:creator: Nick Toscano
item.description: An owner of the Portland aluminium smelter is hopeful governments will consider the need to minimise job losses as the economy re-emerges from coronavirus.
item.title: Smelter owner Alumina says securing jobs vital as economy reopens

item.dc:creator: The Herald's View
item.description: The Coalition has now spent seven years in government without a coherent climate policy on reducing emissions. It is time to stop the charade.
item.title: Coalition back to the future on its climate policy

item.dc:creator: Kerri Sackville
item.description: AFL players are seeking guidance on casual dating in the time of coronavirus. Here you go, fellas.
item.title: An AFL player's guide to hooking up (and common decency)

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Thursday, May 21

item.description: The COVID-19 inquiry is a compromise more in line with China's position than ours.
item.title: Deputy sheriff Morrison shoots himself in the foot

item.dc:creator: John Hewson
item.description: The “blip” our Reserve Bank saw in the 1970s has been replaced by “snap back” or “bounce back", writes the former Liberal leader.
item.title: The RBA misread the economic upheaval of the 1970s, and I fear it is again

item.dc:creator: Percy Allan
item.description: The Reserve Bank of Australia could give the nation, in effect, a no-interest and non-repayable loan to fund public works.
item.title: The 'free ride' we can't afford to spurn: how the RBA can jump-start our economy

item.dc:creator: Robert Moran
item.description: Whether TV shows, movies or song covers, these remakes did it better than the first time.
item.title: Top five remakes that outdid their originals

item.dc:creator: Harry Hollinsworth
item.description: With the withdrawal of the Royal Marines and RAF, Iceland has regained independence.
item.title: In the Herald: May 21, 1946

item.description: On May 21, 1980, jockey Maurice Logue would honour his mate's memory with a victory in a race named after him: the David Green Stakes.
item.title: From the Archives, 1980: The race he had to win

item.dc:creator: Matt O'Sullivan
item.description: Sydney's lord mayor is renewing a push to halve the size of an 18-hole course at Moore Park, much to the chagrin of golfers.
item.title: 'Scandalous': Clover Moore tees off on size of Sydney golf course

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Thursday, May 14

item.dc:creator: Eryk Bagshaw
item.description: Australian businesses are being pushed by the federal government and industry leaders to diversify away from China.
item.title: Sell elsewhere: Australian producers urged to go beyond China

item.dc:creator: Nick Miller
item.description: A new major arts festival hopes to commission $2 million worth of cultural events and performances for its inaugural 2021 event.
item.title: Melbourne's new festival RISING from the virus crisis

item.dc:creator: Benjamin Preiss
item.description: The tourism sector in Gippsland is losing more than $180 million a month and watching with envy as NSW relaxes travel restrictions.
item.title: After losing $750 million to fires and virus, Gippsland awaits end to bans

item.dc:creator: Kylar Loussikian
item.description: The Federal Circuit Court found a senior tribunal member plagiarised swathes of his decision to boot an Iraqi citizen from the country.
item.title: Federal court slams tribunal's 'cut and paste' judgment

item.dc:creator: Chip Le Grand
item.description: Private pathology companies threatened to refuse COVID-19 testing at the height of the pandemic, forcing the federal government to increase by four-fold its payment for each test.
item.title: Pathology groups threatened COVID-19 test ban at height of pandemic

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: America's largest bank has come under pressure to fully disclose its emissions which could tighten lending for Australia's largest energy companies.
item.title: 'Strong and important signal' : Shareholder strike against US bank could impact Australian resources sector

item.dc:creator: Jessica Irvine
item.description: This pandemic has made us assess what is essential in our lives. Let's add housing, and the provision of safe, secure and affordable homes, to the list.
item.title: A collapse in house prices won't necessarily be so bad

item.description: The finest photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: The best of the world in pictures

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted in the work of our award-winning cartoonists.
item.title: Today's cartoons: The illustrated news

item.dc:creator: Dana McCauley
item.description: The government is considering a proposal to allow young Australians to stay on their parents' health insurance plans until the age of 30.
item.title: Insurers back plan for private health plans to cover kids up to age 30

item.dc:creator: Paul Sakkal
item.description: A teenager has been charged with murder following the death of a 17-year-old in a fight involving fence posts and sticks in St Albans last December.
item.title: 15-year-old charged with murder following brutal western suburbs brawl

item.dc:creator: Tammy Mills
item.description: Protective services officers could continue patrolling major shopping strips and commercial centres after state-of-emergency laws were deemed a success.
item.title: Police push for expanded PSO powers to continue post-pandemic

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: As the day unfolded: China signs on to COVID-19 inquiry at World Health Assembly as NSW announces resumption of regional travel, Australian death toll stands at 100

item.dc:creator: Kate Hedley
item.description: WA Health Minister Roger Cook has confirmed the state's COVID-19 tally remains at 557, with no new cases overnight. Mr Cook said it was a 'delightful position' to be in.
item.title: WA coronavirus LIVE: Western clubs remain in limbo on AFL hub details

item.description: It's the perfect storm - a cyclone has hit densely populated cities and migrant camps during Ramadan as COVID-19 infection numbers soar.
item.title: Strongest cyclone in over a decade slams into India and Bangladesh

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: After losing their opening two games of the season, the Roosters have been handed the arduous task of squaring off against the Raiders and Storm, as well as the Rabbitohs and Broncos, twice.
item.title: Who your NRL team plays twice: Roosters dealt toughest draw, Eels one of easiest
